text: Draught at Warpigs, Copenhagen. Hazy pale golden beer with a decent offwhite head. Sourish lemon aroma, wheat aroma, grassy, citrus notes. Fruity lemon flavor, citrus, grapefruit, some hay. Ok but maybe not true to the style.
Hazy yellow. White head. Fruity and wheaty like aroma. Spicy fruity hoppy flavor. Some malty and wheaty notes.
Draught at WarPigs Brewpub, Copenhagen. Clear yellow - white head. Ok bitterness. Light malty. Citric. Honey notes. Grassy. Hay. Straw. High drinkability.

How: Draught.
Where: Warpigs, Copenhagen.
Appearance: Clear golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Sweet malt, fruit, floral.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Fruit, hops, citrus, malt.
Tap @ Warpigs. Clear golden pour with a frothy head. Notes of biscuits, hops, green grass, grain and some citrus.

Draft @ the brewpub. Pours a slightly hazy yellow golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty creamy grainy aroma. Fruity malty creamy caramel flavor with weak hoppy hints. Has a fruity malty creamy finish.
Tap @ Warpigs. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma is citrussy, hoppy, bready, malty, floral and piney. Taste is citrussy, hoppy, bready, malty and has some straw to it aswell.
From tap at the brewpub. Hazy yellow colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of fruit, malt, hops, citrus and peach.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Viktoriagade. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, fruity, flowers and perfume. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 180815
Draft. A hazy yellow beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of straw and citrusy hops. The flavor is sweet with notes of citrusy hops, malt, and straw, leading to a bitter finish.

Aroma and taste has fruity and floral notes, with some sweet bready malts, straw, hay, and piney notes, pretty decent overall.
Draught at Warpigs. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma medium malty (wheat, bread) and hoppy (hay, piney). Flavor medium sweet and bitter. Medium body. Really drinkably.

Draught at the brewpub.
Hazy golden colored with a medium sized white head.
Fruity aroma of hay, hops and pine needles.
Fruity flavor of hops and pine needles with notes of licorice.
Hoppy finish.

Cloudy yellow small white head. Fruity and flowery aroma. Mild. Citrus fruits. More dry than a Belgian would be. Flavor is peach citrus fruit pine hops and faint but noticeable sweet malts. Great thirst quencher.
From tap. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is mild citrusy and crisp hoppy. Citrusy, peachy and smooth fruity. Mild grainy. Smooth fruity and mellow. Bitter and crisp fruity finish.
